channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very severe pothole, makes the vehicle dip and roll suddenly.right when about to exit to A417 s/bound from M5 at jcn 11a s/bound., 27th February
item.description:
Big pothole, causes vehicle instability at motorway speed. Still has not been addressed. Could potentially cause damage to vehicles with smaller diameter wheels. Could potentially cause temporary distraction to concentration as exiting motorway to A-road sliproad.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parked on footpath, 26th February
item.description:
This an ongoing and permanent problem. As can be seen in the photographs these cars are totally parked on the footpath blocking pedestrian access and damaging the footpath surface. This is the case every day of the working week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Unit c Malmesbury Road, Kingsditch Trading Estate
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over hanging hedge, 26th February
item.description:
The Hedge is so wide the pavement is reduced to half its normal width so people are walking on the verge. This also applies to many pavements in Benhall.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Benhall Playgroup Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover - causing noise disturbance, 26th February
item.description:
Loose manhole cover located on the A435 between the roundabout to the Greenacres/Cleevelands new estates and the new traffic lights near the old Nortenham allotments. The noise when trucks etc go over it is very loud clack clack. I live on the Deans Lea estate about 300m away and even with the A435 traffic & double glazed windows closed we hear the clack clack a lot, depending on traffic. It's been like this since Monday at least when we walked that way. How people who live closer can sleep at night with this random noise, I don't know. Please can it be sorted ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on southbound exit slip, 26th February
item.description:
There is a large pothole which measures around 30 x 30cm on the southbound exit slip round just at the start of the slip round which is likely to cause significant damage to vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very loose manhole cover causing severe noise and damage, 25th February
item.description:
A manhole cover on the A435 very near houses in Cherry Blossom Close and Bramble Chase is loose and is causing very high volume metallic noise when every time any vehicle passes over it, 24/7 and it's causing unaccapetable high noise volume to surrounding houses

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Bishops Cleeve
